title: Geth uses 233% of my CPU
body:
Hi guys.

I'm wondering why my geth client is using so much CPU.

Intel  Xeon E3-1245v2, 32GB DDR3 1600 MHz, SSD, Ubuntu 16.04, Geth v1.6.5

Command line:
nohup ~/ethereum/geth --fast --rpc --rpcapi "db,eth,personal,txpool" --rpcaddr 127.0.0.1 --rpcport 7700 --cache 1024 &

Log file:
INFO [06-07|10:18:01] Imported new chain segment               blocks=1 txs=90  mgas=4.572 elapsed=554.977ms mgasps=8.238  number=3834184 hash=1424cf…fa40ec

INFO [06-07|10:19:24] Imported new chain segment               blocks=1 txs=30  mgas=4.699 elapsed=202.917ms mgasps=23.159 number=3834191 hash=73c77b…1c3a03
INFO [06-07|10:20:01] Imported new chain segment               blocks=1 txs=0   mgas=0.000 elapsed=12.272ms  mgasps=0.000  number=3834192 hash=78efbc…5c95e2
INFO [06-07|10:20:05] Imported new chain segment               blocks=1 txs=14  mgas=0.316 elapsed=95.388ms  mgasps=3.311  number=3834193 hash=a67a9e…2935e1
INFO [06-07|10:20:11] Imported new chain segment               blocks=1 txs=39  mgas=4.665 elapsed=82.575ms  mgasps=56.499 number=3834194 hash=41640b…aa5a4d

INFO [06-07|10:20:50] Imported new chain segment               blocks=1 txs=1   mgas=0.021 elapsed=7.245ms   mgasps=2.898  number=3834197 hash=da1fcd…d31912
INFO [06-07|10:21:04] Imported new chain segment               blocks=1 txs=10  mgas=0.210 elapsed=39.803ms  mgasps=5.276  number=3834198 hash=aabe64…2e4ffa
INFO [06-07|10:21:18] Imported new chain segment               blocks=1 txs=69  mgas=2.663 elapsed=231.233ms mgasps=11.516 number=3834199 hash=7ac39c…dc2003
INFO [06-07|10:21:21] Imported new chain segment               blocks=1 txs=0   mgas=0.000 elapsed=17.745ms  mgasps=0.000  number=3834200 hash=a831c8…cf0f24

INFO [06-07|10:22:30] Imported new chain segment               blocks=1 txs=4   mgas=0.103 elapsed=21.397ms  mgasps=4.791  number=3834203 hash=1bef51…291d2c

Anyone has the same as me?
Thanks in advance!
Yes - syncing the chain is CPU intensive - you might want to think about "--light"

I need to resync wallet with light option? or just need to change --fast to --light??
I'm asking because after the changing --fast to --light it didn't take effect on CPU load.
Sync will max out your available resources until it catches up. Light will do it faster, but it will still need to process a lot of stuff.
